doc.after: About 37,000Â Thoroughbred foals are registered each year in North America,[72] with the largest numbers being registered in the states of Kentucky, Florida and California.[73][notes 3] Australia is the second largest producer of Thoroughbreds in the world with almost 30,000Â broodmares producing about 18,250Â foals annually.[75] Britain produces about 5,000 foals a year,[76] and worldwide, there are more than 195,000Â active broodmares, or females being used for breeding, and 118,000Â newly registered foals in 2006 alone.[77] The Thoroughbred industry is a large agribusiness, generating around $34Â billion in revenue annually in the United States and providing about 470,000Â jobs through a network of farms, training centers and race tracks.[78]
